intro: Tieghemopanax elegans, commonly known as the elegant panax, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically orange or red in color, which contain the seeds. It is often found in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
